M.P. (Shelleys Knockholt, Kent) whom I met at dinner when visiting Lady Limerick on July 19

sends me a newspaper report of a speech in which he quoted my saying about the 3 obligations into which we are born – to God, to Country, and to Home – & which form the bases of Duty. They are trite enough, but they seem to have 'bitten' on to something in his mind, for he refers to them often. I sent him by way of acknowledgement a copy of my pamphlet on 'Church & State in England', and my Spital Sermon. He is, I should suppose, an excellent specimen of the political churchman, to whom churchmanship has mainly been identified with "Church Defence", and who find the notion of disestablishing the church in its own interest extraordinarily hard to understand. The process of education will be a slow one, but it has certainly made a beginning, and will go on at an ever quickening pace. At any moment something may happen which will make the Establishment apparently intolerable.
